intro: Spermacoce incognita, commonly known as the false nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. Spermacoce incognita is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
